definition: to get sb involved in one's trouble/Taiwan pr. [dai4 lei4]
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Certainly he wasn't going to involve the other comrades.
sentences.chinese: 他肯定不想带累别的同志。

sentences.english: I apology for my carelessness which brings you much trouble.
sentences.chinese: 因为我的疏忽给你带累很多麻烦，对不起。

sentences.english: This seriously implicate the Gulf Coast's tourism industry.
sentences.chinese: 这严重带累了墨西哥湾沿岸的旅游业。

definition: to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
to cause or lead to sth bad
(of an official) to lose one's job
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
